title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates and sets the new pay rates for various federal employees and officials, including military personnel, senior executives, judges, and members of Congress. It ensures these pay adjustments are effective starting in 2016 and supersedes a previous pay adjustment order.
potential_concerns: Adjustments in pay rates may lead to budgetary constraints affecting workforce size or hiring in the federal workforce, impacting federal employees and potentially military readiness.
Pay changes for military personnel could affect retention or morale if perceived as insufficient relative to private sector or inflation, influencing military readiness and force structure.
Veterans relying on updated pay schedules in Veterans Health Administration roles might face staffing shortages if pay adjustments do not remain competitive, impacting veterans' healthcare quality.

Locality-based comparability payments might create disparities or perceived inequities among federal employees working in different geographic areas, potentially causing morale or recruitment challenges.

Updating pay rates for political appointees and senior executives could raise concerns about appropriateness during budget tightening, potentially creating public or internal perceptions of unfairness.
